titleStmt.title: The Lamentable fall of Queene Elnor, vvho for her pride and vvickednesse, by Gods iudgment, sunke into the ground at Charing crosse, and rose vp againe at Queene hiue. To the tune of, Gentle and curteous.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "VVhen Edward was in England King the first of all that name:".
Identified as STC 991 at reel 168:14, and as STC 7608 at reel 381:12.
Imperfect: torn with loss of print.
Appears at reels 168, 381, and 1813 (same copy filmed three times).
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
